content: easy escapade beanie design by amy drossner copyright © november 2021 the easy escapade beanie is fast simple and easy it is completely customizable to any size at nearly every step so you ll be sure to get the perfect fit you ll finish crocheting this hat in record time so you can quickly put it on and go on your cold weather escapades in comfort and warmth the easy escapade beanie by amy drossner copyright © november 2021 1 pattern notes you can use either yarn weight #5 or #6 depending on your preference the pattern adjustments for each weight will be indicated by green blue for example single_crochet 7 10 it also works very well to work with 2 strands together of yarn weight #4 and follow instructions in green in the pattern this is actually what i do most often as i like to pair up and combine different color combinations ● bulky weight #5 yarn - approximately 80-90 yards or ● super bulky weight #6 yarn - approximately 70-80 yards ● hook sizes ○ for yarn weight 5 k/6 5 mm and l/8 mm ○ for yarn weight 6 m/9 mm and n/10 mm final size - 8 5 x 8 tall laid flat and unstretched if matching pattern gauge the final dimensions are very easily customizable the height along with the width is very easily adaptable just add or subtract row as you work the ribbing and the initial row of the body to ensure a custom fit by either trying it on at various intervals or by measuring to specific dimensions be sure to carefully read the occasional note in the pattern for where there is a change if you added or subtracted row of ribbing gauge the gauge isn t really pertinent for this pattern since you can customize the ribbing to your size or to any customized size before joining and beginning the body for a point of reference i ll provide here the measurements for the hats that i wear and the hats in the photos ribbing with yarn weight 5 or two strands of weight #4 together and a hook size k/6 5 mm after 20 row the ribbing piece laid flat and unstretched is 7 5 inches at 40 row laid flat and unstretched the piece is 15 inches long the easy escapade beanie by amy drossner copyright © november 2021 2 with yarn weight 6 and a hook size m/9 mm after 16 row the ribbing piece laid flat and unstretched is 7 5 inches at 32 row laid flat and unstretched the piece is 15 inches long stitches and abbreviations slip_stitch - slip_stitch single_crochet - single_crochet hbdc - herringbone double_crochet blo - back loop only decrease - decrease 2 stitches together invj - invisible join ❖ i really hate the visible noticeable seam that results from slip stitching row closed so i always join row with an invisible join -
